column4: I'm currently running a Ubuntu Server with an 80GB main hard drive and a 120GB storage drive
I want to reformat my 80GB drive, and partition it so Ubuntu gets 15GB, and the remainder is dedicated to storage
is it best to partition the 65GB left as /home?
or partition it completely separate, and mount the partition in fstab
also, how much space should a ubuntu server install have?
I just want LAMP for home stuff, and GNUMP3D
is 15GB too much, or enough?
and is /home a good idea, or make a storage partition?
depends alot what you plan to do
well, all the server acts as is a NAS
minimal server with only needed stuff easily lives in 15G
thats good idea
just remeber that gloval /tmp isnt mentioned for big tmp data :) like i did
/tmp /var and such will live in the 10GB / partition
apache/postgresql/mysql etc programs default to /var/
so if you dont plan to use big databses or big www-pages then 10G for / is enougth

and if you notice that /var or another directory starts to eat too much space, its just adding one hd more and moving dir to it and mounting it on /whatever
